item.title: Memories Off Sousou: Break out of my shell announced for PS5, PS4, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

Due out in early winter 2026 in Japan.

MAGES. has announced Memories Off Sousou: Break out of my shell for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC (Steam). It will launch in early winter 2026 in Japan with Japanese, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language support.

Memories Off Sousou: Break out of my shell is a fan disc to the Memories Off series’ 25th anniversary title Memories Off Sousou: Not always true, which launched on April 10 in Japan.

Here is the first key visual:

Further details were not announced.

Visit the teaser website here.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/memories-off-sousou-break-out-of-my-shell-announced-for-ps5-ps4-switch-and-pc

item.title: Lost in Fantaland for PS5, PS4, and Switch launches October 9
item.content:encoded:
• PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

Currently available for PC, iOS, and Android.

Supernature Games-developed tactical card RPG Lost in Fantaland will launch for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch on October 9, publisher Game Source Entertainment and developer Supernature Studio announced.

Lost in Fantaland first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam on September 26, 2022, followed by a full release on September 26, 2024. iOS and Android versions launched in June 2025.

Here is an overview of the game, via Game Source Entertainment:

About

Lost in Fantaland is a tactical card RPG where players use action cards on a grid-based board to survive battles with minimal damage. Set against the popular isekai (otherworld) theme, the story follows a protagonist who, after getting lost, is pulled into a mysterious otherworld. Guided by a “mysterious figure,” the protagonist navigates an unknown and perilous realm, using available resources (cards) to struggle for survival in a world filled with danger.

Key Features

  • Highly Randomized Game Mechanics
    • In Lost in Fantaland, aside from the fixed map background for each chapter, level events, enemy types and quantities, and battlefield setup are entirely randomized. This ensures endless replayability, allowing players to embark on countless unique survival journeys in a near-infinitely varied world!
  • Ever-Changing Terrain and Cards
    • To survive in Lost in Fantaland, players must first master the terrain and their cards. On an 8×8 grid, every action can significantly impact the outcome of the game.
    • Leverage the environment to set traps for enemies, exploit strategic positioning for hit-and-run tactics to avoid encirclement, and minimize damage in each battle to maximize your chances of survival.
  • Survive in a Mysterious Board-Based World Using Diverse Items and Cards
    • In Lost in Fantaland, players can choose from various occupations, each with unique cards and rare treasures. Forge your strategy and learn to wield their power to survive. While failure is an expected part of your journey, you can use Soul Orbs earned at the end of each run to enhance your abilities, making complete victory an achievable goal!
    • Additionally, players must also carefully study enemy traits and behaviors. While a single enemy may not be too difficult to handle, a group acting together can create overwhelming trouble in an instant! Learning enemy behavior patterns and predicting their actions will greatly enhance a player’s chances of survival.
  • Running Away Is Not Shameful—It’s Actually Useful
    • Given the scarcity of recovery options, minimizing battle damage is the central focus of Lost in Fantaland. You don’t need to defeat every monster in each chapter. If you’re uncertain about your remaining health, choosing to skip unnecessary battles and head straight for the Boss is a valid tactic—after all, survival is what defines a successful adventure. There are even specific items that allow you to escape non-Boss battles entirely.

Lost in Fantaland is full of surprises and randomness. Use your cards to craft powerful high-damage or high-defense combos, defeat the otherworldly monsters, and pave your way back home! With repeated challenges, you might even uncover the hidden secrets of this mysterious world—who knows?!



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/lost-in-fantaland-for-ps5-ps4-and-switch-launches-october-9

item.title: PlayStation: The First 30 Years photography book announced
item.content:encoded:
• PlayStation

Due out in spring 2026.

Sony Interactive Entertainment has announced PlayStation: The First 30 Years, a 400-page, large-format, hardcover photography book due out in spring 2026.

Pre-orders for the book are available now in the following editions:

  • Standard Edition ($125)
    • A copy of the book
  • Deluxe Edition ($325) – Limited to 1,994 copies
    • A copy of the book
    • Exposed binding
    • Clamshell presentation box
    • Exclusive prints
  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the book, via publisher Read-Only Memory:

PlayStation: The First 30 Years is the definitive visual chronicle of Sony’s world-changing videogame console, marking its 30th anniversary with unprecedented access to the company’s archive of R&D prototypes, concept sketches, and development models. Across 400 large-format pages, the book showcases never-before-seen consoles, controllers, and design studies—from experimental early mockups that never left the studio to the finely honed forms of the PlayStation console through to the PlayStation 5 console.

Alongside these striking images are insights from the engineers and designers who shaped PlayStation’s identity, including Ken Kutaragi, Teiyu Goto, and Yujin Morisawa, revealing the creative and technical decisions behind some of the most iconic hardware in gaming history. Available in a Standard Edition and a Deluxe Edition limited to 1,994 copies, the latter featuring exposed binding, a clamshell presentation box, and exclusive prints, PlayStation: The First 30 Years is an essential celebration of three decades of design innovation and cultural impact.

The book’s stunning visuals have been captured by photographer Benedict Redgrove, chosen for this project following his celebrated 2019 publication NASA: Past and Present Dreams of the Future.

PlayStation: The First 30 Years is art directed by Michael C. Place and designed by Nicole Motby, working together at Studio.Build. Place is renowned for creating the iconic packaging for the PlayStation launch title WipEout, as well as its sequels WipEout 2097 and WipEout 3.

This publication has been produced in direct collaboration with PlayStation and is exclusive to Read-Only Memory.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/playstation-the-first-30-years-photography-book-announced

item.title: 2XKO adds Teemo
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Playable at Early Access launch.

Teemo, the Swift Scout, will be a playable champion in League of Legends-based free-to-play tag fighting game 2XKO, developer Riot Games announced.

The new champion will be playable when the PC version of 2XKO launches in Early Access on October 7.

2XKO is due out in Early Access for PC on October 7, followed by a full release across PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC.

Watch a new trailer below.

Teemo Gameplay Reveal Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/2xko-adds-teemo

item.title: Brotato post-launch development moved to Evil Empire
item.content:encoded:
The Rogue Prince of Persia developer Evil Empire has taken over the post-launch development of Brotato, the Blobfish-developed, multi-million-selling roguelike action shooter, the company announced.

Evil Empire is known for its long and steady years of support for Dead Cells from Motion Twin, which ended with the downloadable content “Return to Castlevania.” The Evil Empire team, founded by ex-Motion Twin developers, was originally created for this specific type of development—supporting and working with game communities to bring new content to beloved games.

“I’m excited to see how the game evolves under the direction of such a talented team and what fresh perspectives they’ll bring to the table,” said Blobfish CEO Thomas Gervraud in a press release. “Above all, though, I’m just eager to dive back in and have fun playing Brotato again.”

Here is a sneak peek at what players can expect when Brotato gets its first fill update in October—a new mob called “The Gobbler”:


Here is a brief overview of the game, via Evil Empire:

Brotato launched in 2023 and since then the top-down arena shooting roguelike has spawned more than 10 million-plus players around the world across PC, console, and mobile platforms. Already a robust title for solo or cooperative players, Evil Empire is joining in to keep baking Brotato, adding the ever-necessary topping of fire updates packed with new content and even more roguelike goodness. Experienced shepherds of roguelikes that they are, Evil Empire’s additions to Brotato won’t be thrown on willy-nilly (much like tuna on a baked potato, because who even does that).

Brotato is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, PC via Steam, iOS, and Android.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/brotato-post-launch-development-moved-to-evil-empire
